titleStmt.title: C. H. Smith v. William Cochrane. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus

bibl.title: C. H. Smith v. William Cochrane. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of King ss In the district court holding terms at Seattle. In the matter of the application of Th I. H. Smith. For a writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Hon. Thomas Burke Judge of the said Court.

Your petitioner I. H. Smith would most respectfully show that he is unlawfully imprisoned detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by William Cochrane Sheriff of King County Washington Territory, in a wooden frame building recently constructed by the said William Cochrane and situated near the Court House of the City of Seattle in said County and Territory.

That the cause or pretense of restraint according to the best of knowledge and beleif of your petitioner is a certain so-called warrant pf commitment dated the 8th. day of Oct. 1888 and signed by James Hart Justice for Slaughter Precinct of said County.

That said imprisonment and restraint is illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this, that the said Justice of the Peace James Hart has no power under law to try peititoner for the offense described in said commitment.

That the said warrant of commitment shows that the said Justice of the Peace had by judgement of his court sentenced your petitioner to imprisionment in the County jail of said County for the term of one year.
That said Justice had no jurisdiction or power to render such judgement of imprisonment or to sentence or direct

Wherefor your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus maybe granted direct tomthe said William Cochrane sheriff as aforesaid commanding him to have the body of t he said I. J. Smith beforee your honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive which shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning the said I. J H. Smith together with the time and cause of hid detention and the said writ; and that he the said Smith be restored to his liberty.
Territory of Washington, County of King ss
I. J. C. H. Smith being duly sworn on oath states that he is the petitioner in the foregoing petition that he has heard the same read knows the contentd theref and beleives the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me Feb 8th 1889 Richard Osborn Notary Public
